required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pulmonary Resectable Metastases of Osteosarcoma With Apatinib and CHemotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Study of Gemcitabine-docetaxel Chemotherapy With VEGFR Inhibitor (Apatinib) for Pulmonary Resectable Metastases of Osteosarcoma

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Second-line chemotherapy combined with Apatinib for the patients with resectable pulmonary metastasis of osteosarcoma.

detailed_description.textblock: After standard chemotherapy and surgery for the localized disease, pulmonary metastases of osteosarcoma occurs in up to 40% of cases and still remain challenging without satisfactory regimen. Apatinib is a oral kinase inhibitor of receptor tyrosine targeting VEGFR2. A pilot study indicated that Apatinib improved the PFS after multi-line chemotherapy failure, and might partly reversed chemo-refractory status for advanced osteosarcoma. Thus, the investigators explored the efficacy of combining Apatinib with current available second-line chemotherapy compared to chemotherapy alone for treating first resectable pulmonary metastases of osteosarcoma following the failure of first-line chemotherapy and wide/radical-margin surgery. Participants will receive 250 mg of apatinib twice daily combined with gemcitabine-docetaxel (GD) regimen before and after the surgical resection of the pulmonary metastases. Osteosarcoma patients with pulmonary recurrence only at baseline will be recruited in the study. The primary end point is progression-free survival rate (PFR) compared with historical control. A12 month PFR of 30% or less is considered inactive, while a 12 month PFR of 50% or greater is regarded as of interest for additional development. With a type I error rate of 5% and a power of 83%, the number of patients needed for this design is 43.

study_design_info.masking_description: An Independent radiologic reviewing committee assess the radiological tumor response in a blinded manner. Data Safety and Monitoring Board (DSMB) access the outcome in the interim analysis and final analysis

primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months from the recruitment of the study
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of paitents with progression-free survival at 12 months according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1). A 12mPFR of 30% or less is considered inactive, while a 12mPFR of 50% or greater is regarded as of interest for additional development

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until death, followed through study completion, an average of 2 years
secondary_outcome.description: calculated from the date of treatment start until last follow-up or death, whichever comes first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: after neoadjuvent systemic therapy, an average of 8~9 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients undergoing pre-planned metastasectomy divided by the number of patients considered resectable at baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events [Safety and Tolerability]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 years
secondary_outcome.description: The occurrence of each adverse events(AEs), severe AEs(SAEs) and death according the CTCAE_5.0

secondary_outcome.time_frame: after neoadjuvent systemic therapy, an average of 8~9 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Complete Response(CR)+Partial Response(PR) after neoadjuvent systemic therapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: after neoadjuvent systemic therapy, an average of 8~9 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: CR+PR+stable disease (SD) after neoadjuvent systemic therapy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or death, whichever occurs first (followed through study completion, an average of 1.5 years)
secondary_outcome.description: Progression free survival according to RECIST 1.1
the proportion of OS at 12, 24 months

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory outcome: Subgroup analysis of progression-free survival(PFS)
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or death, whichever occurs first (followed through study completion, an average of 1.5 years)
other_outcome.description: The PFS for each subgroups in terms of clinicopathological characteristics (age, gender, histological type, solitary or multiple metastases, unilateral or bilateral metastases, early or late metastases, calcifying or non-calcifying lesions, with or without lesion cavitation, with or without AEs [especially pneumothorax, hand-foot skin reactions, hair depigmentation], etc)

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory outcome: The correlation of potential pathological biomarker with PFS
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or death, whichever occurs first (followed through study completion, an average of 1.5 years)
other_outcome.description: The correlation between the expression of VEGFR2, CD34, Ki-67 and immune cell infiltration by immunohistochemistry and PFS

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory outcome: Tumor response pre-metastasectomy as a predictor of PFS
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or death, whichever occurs first (followed through study completion, an average of 1.5 years)
other_outcome.description: to compare the PFS of the three group according to tumor response pre-metastasectomy (group1: CR/PR, group2: SD, group3 PD)

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory outcome: Tumor cavitation as a prognostic factor for oncological outcome
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or death, whichever occurs first (followed through study completion, an average of 1.5 years)
other_outcome.description: to compare the predictive value of the Crabb's modified RECIST criteria with the original RECIST 1.1 criteria in terms of PFS and OS

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory outcome: AEs of the targeted therapy as prognostic factors for oncological outcome, especially pulmonary lesion cavitation/pneumothorax and hair depigmentation
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or death, whichever occurs first (followed through study completion, an average of 1.5 years)
other_outcome.description: to correlate the incidence of targeted therapy related AEs （especially pneumothorax, hand foot skin reactions, skin and hair depigmentation and fatigue）with the PFS/OS for the treatment arm.

other_outcome.measure: Correlation of KDR 604 polymorphism with pulmonary lesion cavitation/pneumothorax and with PFS
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or death, whichever occurs first (followed through study completion, an average of 1.5 years)
other_outcome.description: According to our previous retrospective analysis, we aim the validate the correlation of KDR 604 AA，AG，GG genotype with the incidence of pulmonary lesion cavitation/pneumothorax and PFS among all patients.

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory outcome: 1.0-mm CT scan for the early identification small lung nodule as pulmonary recurrence
other_outcome.time_frame: Baseline until disease progression or death, whichever occurs first (followed through study completion, an average of 1.5 years)
other_outcome.description: to compare the diagnostic value of the 1.0 mm versus 5.0 mm CT scan for the radiological evaluation of small lung nodule as tumor recurrence

arm_group.description: Apatinib + GD regimen. For unilateral metastases,3 cycles before metastasectomy, and 4 cycles after. For bilateral metastases, 3 cycles before first metastasectomy, 1 cycle inbetween, and then second metastasectomy followed by 4 cycles. Apatinib monotherapy is then maintained until 1 year following complete resection.

intervention.description: Apatinib 250mg tablet by mouth, bid. 48 hrs break before and 96 hrs after the surgical resection of the pulmonary metastases.

One cycle: gemcitabine 900 mg/m^2 over 90 min on Day 1, and gemcitabine 900 mg/m^2 and docetaxel 75 mg/m^2 on Day 8. Every 21 days were eligible. 1~2 -week break before and 2-week break after the surgical resection of the pulmonary metastases is taken.

facility.name: Ruijin Hospital Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
